page.title: 18POETS WALK
page.content: The footpath which runs around{Wain's {Hill}overlooking the Bristol Channel in the{West End of Clevedon}is called Poet's Walk because reputedly poets such as Coleridge,Wordsworth and Tennyson would seek inspiration. Nowadays it is a peaceful place for a pleasant walk giving views of Clevedon,the channel and the south Wales coast. There does seem to be a need to improve safety fencing around the cliff edges and benches could be restores,having suffered from vandalism.Dogs fouling the footpath have also been a source of local concern. It is a place which attracts day trippers and though it is quiet during the week it gets very busy at the weekend.
